front.reference:
BLED WORKSHOPS
IN PHYSICS
VOL. 8, NO. 1
p. 17
Proceedings of the Mini-Workshop
Hadron Structure and Lattice QCD
Bled, Slovenia, July 9-16, 2007

docTitle.titlePart:
Does nucleon parity doubling imply U A (1) symmetry
restoration?
⋆

byline.docAuthor:
V. Dmitrašinovi´c
a , K. Nagata
b , A. Hosaka
c

byline.affiliation: a Vinča Institute of Nuclear Sciences,
b Department of Physics, Chung-Yuan Christian University,
c Research Center for Nuclear Physics, Osaka University,

front.div:
Abstract. We examine the role of U A (1) symmetry and its breaking/restoration in two
complete chiral multiplets consisting of the nucleon and the Roper and their two " chiral
mirror " odd-parity resonances. We base our work on the recent classification of the chiral
SU L (2) × SU R (2) transformation properties of the two (Ioffe) independent local tri-quark
nucleon interpolating fields in QCD [1].
